contentList.content: Kanala
Kanalas utilize powerful gifts given to them by a creature, object, or intangible force that has become incorporated into their very bodies and souls.
Layered Leather Armor
A hardened leather surcoat that's heavier than it looks.
Gift Source
The source of your power determines your early capabilities, your spellcasting ability, and the appearance of your locus - the externalized part of your gift.
Latent Energy

You are connected to a hidden force that protects you as best it can. While not wearing armour, you add your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Symbiotic Creature
You share your body with a creature that affords you fantastic powers in exchange for fresh food. You can let it consume the remains of a nearby creature to regain hit points.
Consume Remains
Heal yourself by consuming a corpse with your locus.
Locus Forms
Your locus is more than an extension of your gift: it is a tool for solving the countless obstacles you face as an adventurer.
Locus Energy
Your gift supplies you with a locus of power that allows you to channel elemental energy into your strikes.
Use your locus to collect elemental power within your body. You deal an additional 1d4 damage of your choice with weapon attacks, unarmed strikes, and throws.
Locus Energy: Acid
Imbue yourself with corrosive energy. You deal an additional [1].
Locus Energy: Cold
Imbue yourself with freezing energy. You deal an additional [1].
Locus Energy: Fire
Imbue yourself with burning energy. You deal an additional [1].
Locus Energy: Lightning
Imbue yourself with electricity. You deal an additional [1].
Locus Energy: Thunder
Imbue yourself with booming energy. You deal an additional [1].
Deals an additional [1] with weapon attacks, unarmed strikes, and throws.
Locus Weapon
Your transmutative power can alter your equipped weapon, allowing it to perform more kinds of weapon actions.
Add a blunt, sharp, or pointed aspect to your equipped weapon, allowing it to perform the appropriate weapon actions.
Locus Weapon: Pointed
You can perform the following weapon actions: Brace, Disarming Strike, Flourish, Piercing Strike, and Rush Attack.
Locus Weapon: Sharp
You can perform the following weapon actions: Cleave, Lacerate, Maiming Strike, Pommel Strike, and Prepare.
Locus Weapon: Blunt
You can perform the following weapon actions: Backbreaker, Concussive Smash, Heartstopper, Topple, and Weakening Strike.
Bound

Your locus empowers your legs to help you make great leaps.

Your Jump distance is increased by [1].
Guise
Mildly suggestive magic can be released by your locus, allowing you to temporarily gain a creature's favor or cause those around you to hear your voice at a booming volume.
Pull
Tendrils can sprout from your locus, allowing you to pull all but the biggest creatures and items closer to you.
Pulls the target [1] closer to you.
Trip
The power within your locus grasps at enemies who attempt to escape you.
Attack an enemy moving out of your reach with your locus and possibly knock it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
